content: The docs are very convenient for this: for example, you can go to docs#inner_product_space, then click on "Instances" below the definition and you get all instances of it declared in mathlib.
thanks, I've seen that. Is there no way to do it from within vscode?
Not that I know of. But my guess is that even if there is, it's probably limited to the current imports.

You can use the #print command for this:

#print instances inner_product_space
Although that will be limited by the files you have imported, unlike the docs which are global
Jireh Loreaux has marked this topic as resolved.
